text.text_translated:
Earthquakes can damage bridges.
But bridges do not often fall down.
This is true for new bridges.
Engineers design bridges.
They build them in places with earthquakes.
These bridges can resist movement.
So, they do not move much.

best_attempt.text_translated: An earthquake is when the ground shakes a lot. Earthquakes can damage buildings and bridges. But bridges do not often fall down. This is true for new bridges. Engineers learned how to build bridges better. They build bridges in places where earthquakes happen. They choose parts of these places. The ground in these parts does not move much. This helps bridges stay safe.
